news.title: Fish Oil, Aspirin Don't Preserve Dialysis Access Sites
news.summary: Action Points Note that this randomized trial found no benefit to fish oil or aspirin supplementation to prevent fistula failure in dialysis patients.

news.title: Fish Oil, Aspirin Do Not Lower AVF Failure Risk in Dialysis
news.summary: Neither omega-3 fatty acids from fish nor aspirin prevented failure of arteriovenous fistulae (AVFs) in patients receiving hemodialysis, according to results of a new study published online January 3 in JAMA Internal Medicine.

news.title: More Evidence That Fish Oil Supplements Might Be Useless
news.summary: You most certainly know someone taking fish oil pills—those fishy, translucent gold capsules—for their purported heart benefits.

news.title: More Hospitalist Spending Does Not Mean Better Outcomes
news.summary: Higher spending by individual hospitalists, in terms of more expensive tests or procedures, does not result in better patient outcomes, a new study shows.
